message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with entropy, probability distributions, and information theory, which are all topics commonly studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The study also involves examining probability distributions on finite sets, which falls under the scope of the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The investigation of sharp bounds and optimization problems is a common theme in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The study also involves mutual information and coding theory, which are topics commonly studied in the Signal and Image Processing (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with random coding exponents, which is a topic commonly studied in the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
